cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to meander near the Yucatan Channel through early Monday, then accelerate north-north-east across the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s west coast (Big Bend/Tampa Bay area) and then inland toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near or just north of Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No official watches yet for Florida as of Advisory #3
weather_observation.warning_coast: No official warnings yet for Florida as of Advisory #3
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Naples northward through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay and Manatee County
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (NHC guidance 3–6 inches with isolated 10 inches along the west coast of Florida)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (hurricane-strength system moving onshore from the Gulf toward Tampa Bay/Big Bend typically produces >3 ft surge)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible late Tuesday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks closer to Tampa Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft inundation in and near Tampa Bay and the lower reaches of the Manatee River if the storm intensifies to a hurricane and makes landfall north of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals up to 10 inches possible Tuesday–Wednesday, causing flash flooding in low-lying port areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, hazardous seas and long-period swells impacting vessel operations and berth safety
